revised_title: Growth and Size Variations of Chlorella Vulgaris in Pure Culture
tldr: The authors studied the growth of Chlorella vulgaris in pure culture, focusing on the relations between increases in number, volume, and changes in chemical composition. They found that the growth cycle of Chlorella involves several stages, with variations in cell size and growth rates. The study provides a detailed description of the methods used to measure cell numbers, size, and growth rates, which can be applied to future research on algal growth.
